description: On April 22, the Fijian Ministry of Health and Medical Services released a PR strongly advising all health providers in Fiji to cease offering IgM/IgG rapid tests for the diagnosis of COVID-19.  These tests are based on the detection of antibodies and/or antigens and they are not reliable for the acute diagnosis of COVID-19.

On May 21, Fiji's Ministry of Health and Medical Services responds to an article written by The Fiji Times to address inaccuracies reported by the article regarding the government's response to COVID-19.

On March 20, the Fijian government closed schools that fall within the lockdown zone, "from Kings Road at Nacilau Junction past Matawalu Village, Ba to feeder road at Vakabuli Junction, to the Queens Road at Natalau Junction, Nadi."

description: Fiji will be under a nationwide curfew from 10pm to 5am daily from Monday, 30.03.2020.

Fiji will be under a nationwide curfew from 10pm to 5am daily from Monday, 30.03.2020. This policy ended on June 21. UPDATE: The original policy set curfew for 10PM - 5AM. This policy has been relaxed and a new curfew has been set for 11PM - 4AM.
Fiji announces a lockdown to the region of suva, starting on 03.04.2020.
Fiji announces a lockdown to the region of suva, starting on 03.04.2020. This policy ended on April 17. UPDATE: The original lockdown policy has ended on March 17.
On June 21, Fiji announced relaxed curfew hours enforced from 11 PM - 5 AM.
Fiji refuses the entry to the country to people who have been to Iran, China, Italy or South Korea in the last 14 days.

description: Fiji imposes External border restrictions: Fiji refuses cruise ships to berth anywhere in Fiji, From 18 March 2020

Fiji, 18 of March imposes External Border restrictions: Fiji refuses government ministers, permanent secretaries, civil servants and statutory body staff members to travel overseas barring exceptionally critical circumstances.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Fiji refuses the entry to their country to foreign people who have been to Spain, Italy, Irna, South Korea or China the last 14 days. UPDATE: The entry restrictions have been extended. Spain is now included on the list on 18.03.2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Fiji is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all passengers arriving from or having visited China, Italy, Iran, Republic of Korea, Europe, UK and USA. UPDATE: The travel ban has been extended to people from Europe (+ UK) an USA.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)

description: On June 21, Fiji launched the careFIJI App, a contact tracing "tool that allows us to notify users if they are exposed to the coronavirus."

On June 21, Fiji launched the careFIJI App (a contact tracing app) and is  mandating that all users of government issued phones, members of the disciplined forces, and users with phones issued by government-funded statutory bodies, download the careFIJI App.

As of March 23, there was a total of 8 fever clinics in Fiji. UPDATE: Prior to a total 32 fever clinics, there was only 8 clinics. I am adding the source as an update to reflect the number of clinics before the new entry of 32.

description: On June 1, Fiji Government received medical supplies from the People’s Republic of China. This included "more than 1,000 test supplies from the Chinese Central Government and 1,000 surgical masks, 20,000 medical masks, 5,000 medical disposable protection clothing and 5,000 disposable gloves from the Chinese Local Government, Guangdong Province."

description: Fiji ceases local shipping services from Sunday, 29.03.2020.
On March 19, Fiji government locks down Lautoka City to contain COVID-19. Everyone including those who work but don’t live there are prohibited form entering the city.

On April 1, the Fijian government announced they will be extending the lockdown in Lautoka to April 7. UPDATE: The original policy did not provide an end date; however, recent news updates mentions that the policy will be extended to April 7.
On April 3, Fiji government imposed lockdown measures on the capital city of Suva.

On April 3, Fiji government imposed lockdown measures on the capital city of Suva. On April 17, the Fiji government lifted lockdown measures. UPDATE: The original policy did not have an end date. It was then announced that the lockdown measure will be extended until April 17.

On April 19, "The Fijian Ministry of Health and Medical Services wishes to clarify that the Fijian Government will cover the costs for those individuals who will be kept at the government designated quarantine facilities upon their arrival into the country."
type_text: While the policy is related to quarantine measures, the policy is not outlining quarantine restrictions. Rather the policy addresses the monetary cost of enforcing such quarantine restrictions.

description: On March 26, Fiji's Ministry of Education, Heritage and Arts "has emailed an information package titled 'COVID-19 Information for Communities – Protecting Yourself and Your Family' to individual teacher email addresses to bring about more awareness without compromising their health and safety."
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Fiji bans any gathering greater than 20 persons.
